In case of delays, we’ll email you.
In case of losing the key, contact reception.

rule_text_en: Unless means 'if not'. It introduces the only condition that stops something.
rule_text_uk: Unless означає «якщо не». Це умова, яка зупиняє дію/результат.
examples: I’ll go unless you want me to stay.
Unless you hurry, you’ll miss the train.
We can’t start unless everyone is here.

rule_text_en: As long as / so long as / provided (that) mean 'only if' (a strict condition).
rule_text_uk: As long as / so long as / provided (that) означають «лише за умови, що».
rule_short_en: as long as / provided = only if
rule_short_uk: as long as / provided = лише якщо
examples: You can borrow it as long as you return it today.
We’ll help provided that you tell the truth.
You can stay here so long as you’re quiet.

rule_text_en: Unless is not used for unreal conditions with would; use if … not instead in that case.
rule_text_uk: Unless зазвичай не вживають у нереальних умовах з would; тоді краще if … not.
examples: I wouldn’t go if I didn’t have to.
If you didn’t help, I’d fail.
I’d be lost if I didn’t have a map.

rule_text_en: Use as to mean 'while/at the same time': two actions happen together.
rule_text_uk: As означає «поки/одночасно»: дві дії відбуваються разом.
examples: As I was walking home, it started to snow.
I listened to a podcast as I cooked.
As the day went on, it got colder.

rule_text_en: As can also mean 'because'. Use when (not as) if one thing happens after another.
rule_text_uk: As також означає «бо». When (не as) — коли одна дія стається після іншої.
examples: As it was late, we took a taxi.
When I got home, I called you.
As I didn’t have cash, I paid by card.

rule_text_en: Use as + subject + verb for 'in the same way as'. Like is often possible in informal speech.
rule_text_uk: As + підмет + присудок: «так само як». У розмовній мові часто можна like.
rule_short_en: as + S+V = in the same way
examples: Do it as I showed you.
Leave it as it is.
Nobody reacted as I expected.

rule_text_en: Fixed phrases: as usual / as always; and the same as (not the same like).
rule_text_uk: Стійкі фрази: as usual / as always; та the same as (не the same like).
examples: He was late as usual.
As always, she was calm.
My answer is the same as yours.

rule_text_en: We use like + noun for examples (like / such as).
rule_text_uk: Like + іменник: приклади (like / such as).
examples: I enjoy sports like tennis and swimming.
We sell snacks such as nuts and fruit.
Cities like Lviv and Odesa are popular.

rule_text_en: Expressions: as you know / as I said / do as you like (= do what you want).
rule_text_uk: Вирази: as you know / as I said / do as you like (= роби як хочеш).
rule_short_en: as you know; do as you like
rule_short_uk: as you know; do as you like
examples: As you know, the shop is closed.
Do as you like—it's your decision.
As I said, I can’t meet today.

rule_text_en: Use like / as if / as though + clause after look/sound/seem etc. to describe impressions.
rule_text_uk: Після look/sound/seem тощо: like / as if / as though + підрядне для враження.
examples: It looks like it’s going to rain.
You sound as if you’re tired.
She seems as though she knows them.

rule_text_en: Like/as if/as though can follow other verbs to say how someone does something.
rule_text_uk: Like/as if/as though можуть іти після інших дієслів, щоб описати манеру дії.
rule_short_en: He spoke as if… / ran like…
rule_short_uk: He spoke as if… / ran like…
examples: He acted as if nothing happened.
She laughed like she didn’t care.
They stared at me as though I was crazy.

rule_text_en: After as if/as though we sometimes use past forms to talk about the present (unreal).
rule_text_uk: Після as if/as though інколи вживають минулий час про теперішнє (нереальність).
examples: He talks as if he knew everything.
She looks as though she was ill.
You treat me as if I were a child.

rule_text_en: We often use were (not was) after as if in more formal/unreal style, especially with I/he/she/it.
rule_text_uk: Після as if у більш формальному/нереальному стилі часто вживають were (не was), особливо з I/he/she/it.
examples: He speaks to me as if I were invisible.
It looks as if it were broken.
She smiled as if she were relieved.

rule_text_en: Use for + a period to say how long; not during for duration.
rule_text_uk: For + проміжок часу: тривалість; не during для тривалості.
examples: We talked for ten minutes.
I lived there for two years.
She’s been away for a week.

rule_text_en: Use during to say when something happened within a period (during the meeting/night).
rule_text_uk: During вживаємо, щоб сказати коли сталося щось у межах періоду (during the meeting/night).
rule_short_en: during = at some point in a period
examples: I fell asleep during the film.
Nobody spoke during the presentation.
It rained during the night.

rule_text_en: Use while + clause for two actions at the same time; while + -ing is also possible.
rule_text_uk: While + підрядне: дві дії одночасно; можливе також while + -ing.
examples: I read while she cooked.
While waiting, I checked my email.
He called while I was driving.

rule_text_en: By + time means 'not later than' (deadline): on or before that time.
rule_text_uk: By + час означає «не пізніше ніж» (дедлайн): до або в цей час.
examples: Please reply by Friday.
Be home by 6.
The parcel should arrive by Monday.

rule_text_en: By the time + clause shows one action is finished before another time/event.
rule_text_uk: By the time + підрядне: одна дія завершиться до іншого моменту/події.
rule_short_uk: by the time = до того часу
examples: By the time we arrived, the show had started.
By the time you wake up, I’ll be gone.
She’ll have finished by the time you call.

rule_text_en: Until shows something continues up to a time; by shows completion before a time.
rule_text_uk: Until: дія триває до моменту; by: завершення до моменту.
examples: I’ll wait until 5.
I’ll finish it by 5.
He’ll be away until Monday.

rule_text_en: Use at for clock times, on for days/dates, and in for months, years, seasons and longer periods.
rule_text_uk: Використовуйте at для часу на годиннику, on для днів/дат, а in — для місяців, років, сезонів і довших періодів.
rule_short_en: at 7.30 • on Friday/3 May • in June/2024
rule_short_uk: at 7:30 • on Friday/3 May • in June/2024
examples: The lesson starts at 8.15.
My birthday is on 14 July.
She moved here in 2020.

rule_text_en: Use at in some time expressions: at the moment, at the same time, at weekends, at Christmas; but usually in the morning/afternoon/evening and at night.
rule_text_uk: У деяких сталих виразах з часом вживаємо at: at the moment, at the same time, at weekends, at Christmas; але зазвичай in the morning/afternoon/evening і at night.
rule_short_en: at the moment • at weekends • in the morning • at night
rule_short_uk: at the moment • at weekends • in the morning • at night
examples: I'm busy at the moment.
We often meet at weekends.
I sleep badly at night.

rule_text_en: With parts of the day and days together, use on: on Monday morning, on Friday evening, on the afternoon of 5 June.
rule_text_uk: Коли поєднуємо день і частину дня, вживаємо on: on Monday morning, on Friday evening, on the afternoon of 5 June.
rule_short_en: on Monday morning / on Friday evening
rule_short_uk: on Monday morning / on Friday evening
examples: The call is on Tuesday afternoon.
We had dinner on Friday evening.

rule_text_en: We usually don’t use at/on/in before next, last, this, every: next week, last Friday, this morning, every day.
rule_text_uk: Зазвичай не вживаємо at/on/in перед next, last, this, every: next week, last Friday, this morning, every day.
rule_short_en: next week • last Friday • this morning • every day
rule_short_uk: next week • last Friday • this morning • every day
examples: I'll see you next Monday.
She phoned me this morning.
We train every day.

rule_text_en: Use in to say how long until something happens: in ten minutes (= ten minutes from now).
rule_text_uk: Використовуйте in, щоб сказати, через скільки щось станеться: in ten minutes (= через 10 хвилин).
rule_short_en: in ten minutes = ten minutes from now
examples: The train leaves in five minutes.
I'll be ready in half an hour.

rule_text_en: On time means ‘at the planned time’. In time means ‘early enough’. Just in time means ‘at the last possible moment’.
rule_text_uk: On time означає «в запланований час». In time — «достатньо рано». Just in time — «в останній момент».
rule_short_en: on time (scheduled) • in time (early enough) • just in time
rule_short_uk: on time (за розкладом) • in time (встигнути) • just in time (в останню мить)
examples: The bus arrived on time.
We left early to get there in time.
I caught the lift just in time.

rule_text_en: At the end (of something) is about time/position: at the end of the film. In the end means ‘finally / after a long time’.
rule_text_uk: At the end (of something) — про кінець події/періоду: at the end of the film. In the end означає «зрештою / врешті-решт».
rule_short_en: at the end of the film • in the end = finally
rule_short_uk: at the end of the film • in the end = зрештою
examples: At the end of the meeting we agreed on a plan.
We argued a lot, but in the end we decided to go.

rule_text_en: Use in for an enclosed space or area: in a room, in a building, in a town, in a garden, in the water.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте in для замкненого простору або території: in a room, in a building, in a town, in a garden, in the water.
examples: She’s waiting in the kitchen.
I grew up in a small town.
The kids are playing in the water.

rule_text_en: Use at for a point or place seen as a spot: at the station, at the bus stop, at the door, at the corner.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для точки/місця як «пункту»: at the station, at the bus stop, at the door, at the corner.
examples: Meet me at the entrance.
There’s a café at the corner.

rule_text_en: Use on for a surface or line: on the table, on the wall, on the floor, on the page, on the left/right.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте on для поверхні або лінії: on the table, on the wall, on the floor, on the page, on the left/right.
rule_short_en: on the table/wall/page • on the left/right
rule_short_uk: on the table/wall/page • on the left/right
examples: Your keys are on the desk.
There’s a photo on the wall.
Write your name on the form.

rule_text_en: Use in with lines/rows/groups and with things that have an ‘inside’ space: in a queue, in a row, in a department, in a picture, in the sky.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте in з рядами/чергами/групами та з тим, що має «всередині»: in a queue, in a row, in a department, in a picture, in the sky.
rule_short_en: in a queue/row • in a picture • in the sky
rule_short_uk: in a queue/row • in a picture • in the sky
examples: We stood in a long queue.
I noticed a detail in the picture.
There were dark clouds in the sky.

rule_text_en: Use on for lists/screens and for things on a line or edge: on the left/right, on a map, on a website, on a river/road/coast, on the way.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте on для списків/екранів і для того, що лежить «на лінії/краї»: on the left/right, on a map, on a website, on a river/road/coast, on the way.
rule_short_en: on a map/website • on the coast • on the way
rule_short_uk: on a map/website • on the coast • on the way
examples: Your name is on the list.
The village is on the coast.
We stopped on the way home.

rule_text_en: Use at for the top/bottom/end of something: at the top, at the bottom, at the end of the street.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для верху/низу/кінця чогось: at the top, at the bottom, at the end of the street.
rule_short_en: at the top/bottom • at the end of the street
rule_short_uk: at the top/bottom • at the end of the street
examples: There’s a pharmacy at the end of this street.
The title is at the top of the page.

rule_text_en: For front/back: at the front/back of a building (part of it), in the front/back of a car (inside), and on the front/back of paper or a photo.
rule_text_uk: Для front/back: at the front/back of a building (частина), in the front/back of a car (всередині), і on the front/back of паперу або фото.
rule_short_en: at the front of a building • in the back of a car • on the back of a photo
rule_short_uk: at the front of a building • in the back of a car • on the back of a photo
examples: There’s a garden at the back of the house.
Sit in the back of the taxi.
My address is on the back of the card.

rule_text_en: Use in the corner for inside corners (a room). Use at/on the corner for street corners (a corner point).
rule_text_uk: Вживайте in the corner для внутрішнього кута (кімнати). At/on the corner — для рогу вулиць (точка).
rule_short_en: in the corner (room) • at/on the corner (street)
rule_short_uk: in the corner (кімната) • at/on the corner (вулиця)
examples: There’s a plant in the corner of the room.
The bank is at the corner of King Street and Park Road.

rule_text_en: Some places use in: in bed, in hospital, in prison. But we usually say at home, at work, at school/university.
rule_text_uk: Деякі місця вживаються з in: in bed, in hospital, in prison. Але зазвичай кажемо at home, at work, at school/university.
examples: She’s still in bed.
My brother is in hospital.
I’ll be at work till six.

rule_text_en: Use at for events and meeting places: at a party, at a concert, at a station/airport, at the doctor’s / hairdresser’s.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для подій і місць зустрічі: at a party, at a concert, at a station/airport, at the doctor’s / hairdresser’s.
rule_short_en: at a party/concert • at the station • at the doctor’s
rule_short_uk: at a party/concert • at the station • at the doctor’s
examples: We met at a conference.
I’ll see you at the station.
She’s at the dentist’s.

rule_text_en: With buildings, use at when you mean ‘the place’ and in when you mean ‘inside’: at the cinema (= place), in the cinema (= inside).
rule_text_uk: З будівлями: at — коли маємо на увазі «місце», in — коли «всередині»: at the cinema / in the cinema.
rule_short_en: at the cinema (place) • in the cinema (inside)
rule_short_uk: at the cinema (місце) • in the cinema (всередині)
examples: Let’s meet at the theatre.
It was hot in the theatre.

rule_text_en: Transport: on a bus/train/plane/bike, but in a car/taxi. Get into/out of a car; get on/off a bus.
rule_text_uk: Транспорт: on a bus/train/plane/bike, але in a car/taxi. Get into/out of a car; get on/off a bus.
rule_short_en: on a bus/train/plane • in a car/taxi
rule_short_uk: on a bus/train/plane • in a car/taxi
examples: We met on the train.
She was in a taxi.
He got on the bus quickly.

rule_text_en: In/at with towns: in a town/city (within it), but at a town when it’s a stop on a journey.
rule_text_uk: In/at з містами: in a town/city (в межах міста), але at a town як зупинка в дорозі.
rule_short_en: in Paris (in the city) • stop at Paris (as a stop)
rule_short_uk: in Paris (у місті) • stop at Paris (як зупинка)
examples: We spent a week in Lisbon.
The train stopped at a small town on the way.

rule_text_en: Go/come/travel to a place. Arrive in a country/city and arrive at a building or point. Get to = reach.
rule_text_uk: Go/come/travel to a place. Arrive in — країна/місто; arrive at — будівля або точка. Get to = дістатися.
rule_short_en: go to • arrive in (city) • arrive at (airport) • get to
rule_short_uk: go to • arrive in (місто) • arrive at (аеропорт) • get to
examples: We went to Spain last summer.
They arrived in Rome at noon.
I arrived at the hotel late.

rule_text_en: Home: go home / come home (no preposition). But: be at home, stay at home.
rule_text_uk: Home: go home / come home (без прийменника). Але: be at home, stay at home.
examples: I’m going home now.
We stayed at home all evening.

rule_text_en: Into shows movement to the inside: go into a room, put something into a bag. Compare: in = position, into = movement.
rule_text_uk: Into показує рух усередину: go into a room, put something into a bag. Порівняйте: in = місце, into = рух.
examples: She walked into the kitchen.
Put the keys into your pocket.

rule_text_en: Other movement prepositions: out of, off, on, etc. (get out of a car, take something off a shelf, put it on).
rule_text_uk: Інші прийменники руху: out of, off, on тощо (get out of a car, take something off a shelf, put it on).
examples: He got out of the taxi.
She took the book off the shelf.

rule_text_en: Use in for some conditions and states: in the rain/sun/dark, in a language, in cash, in love, in my opinion.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте in для умов і станів: in the rain/sun/dark, in a language, in cash, in love, in my opinion.
rule_short_en: in the rain • in English • in love • in my opinion
rule_short_uk: in the rain • in English • in love • in my opinion
examples: We got soaked in the rain.
The instructions are in English.
In my opinion, it’s too expensive.

rule_text_en: Use on for media and activities: on TV, on the radio, on the phone, on the internet; and on holiday / on business / on a trip.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте on для медіа й активностей: on TV, on the radio, on the phone, on the internet; а також on holiday / on business / on a trip.
examples: I saw it on TV.
She spoke to me on the phone.
They’re on holiday this week.

rule_text_en: Use at for age, speed and some fixed phrases: at 16, at 80 km/h, at the same time, at the moment.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте at для віку, швидкості та деяких сталих виразів: at 16, at 80 km/h, at the same time, at the moment.
rule_short_en: at 16 • at 80 km/h • at the same time
rule_short_uk: at 16 • at 80 km/h • at the same time
examples: He left home at 18.
The car was travelling at 90 km/h.

rule_text_en: On time (Unit 122) is different from at the time: at the time = then / at that period.
rule_text_uk: On time (Unit 122) відрізняється від at the time: at the time = тоді / у той період.
examples: I didn’t like the job at the time, but I do now.
At the time, we didn’t have a car.

rule_text_en: Use by to say how you do something (method): by car, by bus, by train, by plane; by phone/email; by hand.
rule_text_uk: Вживайте by, щоб сказати, як щось робиться (спосіб): by car/bus/train/plane; by phone/email; by hand.
rule_short_en: by car/bus • by email/phone • by hand
rule_short_uk: by car/bus • by email/phone • by hand
examples: I usually go to work by bus.
Send the file by email.
The dress was made by hand.

rule_text_en: By can also mean ‘not later than’ with time: by 5 o’clock, by Monday. (= at or before).
rule_text_uk: By також означає «не пізніше ніж» з часом: by 5 o’clock, by Monday (= до або раніше).
rule_short_en: by 5 p.m. = at or before 5 p.m.
examples: Please reply by Friday.
I’ll finish it by tomorrow morning.

rule_text_en: Use by to say who/what does an action in the passive, and to say who created something: a book by…, a painting by…
rule_text_uk: By також вживається для виконавця дії в пасиві та автора/творця: a book by…, a painting by…
examples: The window was broken by the wind.
It’s a novel by Kazuo Ishiguro.

rule_text_en: With by + -ing, it can show the means: You can improve by practising; He solved it by calling a friend.
rule_text_uk: Конструкція by + -ing показує спосіб: You can improve by practising; He solved it by calling a friend.
examples: I saved money by cooking at home.
She learned quickly by asking questions.

rule_text_en: By can express difference/amount: by ten minutes, by two euros, by 3%.
rule_text_uk: By може виражати різницю/наскільки: by ten minutes, by two euros, by 3%.
rule_short_en: win by 2 points • late by 10 minutes
rule_short_uk: виграти на 2 очки • запізнитися на 10 хв
examples: We won by two goals.
The train was late by fifteen minutes.

rule_text_en: Many nouns take for: a reason for, a need for, a demand for, an excuse for.
rule_text_uk: Багато іменників вживаються з for: a reason for, a need for, a demand for, an excuse for.
rule_short_en: reason for • need for • demand for • excuse for
rule_short_uk: reason for • need for • demand for • excuse for
examples: There’s no reason for panic.
Is there any need for a meeting?

rule_text_en: Some nouns take of: the cause of, an advantage of, a photo/map of something.
rule_text_uk: Деякі іменники вживаються з of: the cause of, an advantage of, a photo/map of something.
rule_short_en: cause of • advantage of • a photo of
rule_short_uk: cause of • advantage of • фото чогось
examples: The cause of the problem is unclear.
She showed me photos of her trip.

rule_text_en: Some nouns take in: an increase in, a rise in, a fall in, a decrease in (prices, numbers, etc.).
rule_text_uk: Деякі іменники вживаються з in: an increase in, a rise in, a fall in, a decrease in (ціни, кількість тощо).
rule_short_en: increase in • rise in • fall in • decrease in
rule_short_uk: increase in • rise in • fall in • decrease in
examples: There was a rise in prices.
We saw a fall in sales.

rule_text_en: Some nouns take to: damage to, an invitation to, a solution to, a key to, an answer/reply to, a reaction to, an attitude to/towards.
rule_text_uk: Деякі іменники вживаються з to: damage to, an invitation to, a solution to, a key to, an answer/reply to, a reaction to, an attitude to/towards.
rule_short_en: solution to • key to • reaction to • attitude to
rule_short_uk: solution to • key to • reaction to • attitude to
examples: We need a solution to this problem.
His reaction to the news surprised me.

rule_text_en: With and between: a relationship with somebody; a connection between two things; a difference between A and B.
rule_text_uk: З with і between: a relationship with somebody; a connection between two things; a difference between A and B.
rule_short_en: relationship with • connection between • difference between
rule_short_uk: relationship with • connection between • difference between
examples: I have regular contact with my colleagues.
There’s a big difference between the two plans.

rule_text_en: We say it’s nice/kind/etc. of somebody to do something, but nice/kind/etc. to somebody when we describe behaviour towards them.
rule_text_uk: Кажемо it’s nice/kind/etc. of somebody to do something, але nice/kind/etc. to somebody — коли описуємо ставлення до людини.
rule_short_en: nice of you to help • nice to me
rule_short_uk: nice of you to help • nice to me
examples: It was generous of her to pay.
They’re always friendly to visitors.

rule_text_en: Some adjectives take about and with: angry/annoyed about something; angry/annoyed with somebody (often for doing something).
rule_text_uk: Деякі прикметники вживаються з about і with: angry/annoyed about something; angry/annoyed with somebody (часто for doing something).
rule_short_en: angry about the delay • angry with him
rule_short_uk: angry about the delay • angry with him
examples: I’m upset about the mistake.
She was angry with me for being late.

rule_text_en: Other common patterns: surprised at/by, impressed with/by, fed up/bored with, tired of.
rule_text_uk: Інші поширені моделі: surprised at/by, impressed with/by, fed up/bored with, tired of.
rule_short_en: surprised at/by • impressed with/by • bored with • tired of
rule_short_uk: surprised at/by • impressed with/by • bored with • tired of
examples: We were amazed at the view.
I’m tired of arguing.

rule_text_en: Sorry about a situation/event; sorry for doing something; feel sorry for somebody (pity).
rule_text_uk: Sorry about — про ситуацію/подію; sorry for — за те, що зробив; feel sorry for — співчувати комусь.
rule_short_en: sorry about the mess • sorry for shouting • sorry for him
rule_short_uk: sorry about the mess • sorry for shouting • sorry for him
examples: Sorry about yesterday.
I’m sorry for interrupting.
I feel sorry for her.

rule_text_en: Some adjectives are commonly followed by 'of' (e.g. afraid of, proud of, capable of). Use 'of' before a noun or -ing form.
rule_text_uk: Деякі прикметники зазвичай вживаються з 'of' (напр., afraid of, proud of, capable of). 'Of' ставимо перед іменником або формою -ing.
examples: I'm proud of my progress this year.
She was afraid of flying at first.
Are you capable of working under pressure?

rule_text_en: Other adjectives take different prepositions (at, about, for, to, with, from, etc.). The preposition depends on the adjective.
rule_text_uk: Інші прикметники вимагають різні прийменники (at, about, for, to, with, from тощо). Прийменник залежить від прикметника.
examples: I'm interested in modern art.
It's nice of you to help.
She was surprised at the result.

rule_text_en: Many verbs use 'to' before the person you speak/write/listen to: talk to, explain to, apologise to, reply to, belong to, etc.
rule_text_uk: Багато дієслів вживають 'to' перед особою: talk to, explain to, apologise to, reply to, belong to тощо.
examples: I spoke to the manager after the meeting.
Can you explain this to me?
She apologised to her neighbour.

rule_text_en: With some verbs we don't use 'to': phone/call/answer someone, thank someone, ask someone (a question).
rule_text_uk: З деякими дієсловами 'to' не вживаємо: phone/call/answer someone, thank someone, ask someone (a question).
examples: I called my brother last night.
She thanked everyone for coming.
Ask him a question.

rule_text_en: Use 'at' when the action is directed towards a target: look at, smile at, point at, shout at, throw something at.
rule_text_uk: Вживаємо 'at', коли дія спрямована на ціль: look at, smile at, point at, shout at, throw something at.
examples: Don't shout at the kids.
He pointed at the sign.
She smiled at me from across the room.

rule_text_en: at vs to: throw/shout to someone = so they receive/hear it; throw/shout at someone = aimed at them (possibly aggressive).
rule_text_uk: at vs to: throw/shout to someone = щоб вони отримали/почули; throw/shout at someone = кинути/кричати на когось (спрямовано, часто агресивно).
examples: He threw the keys to me.
Someone threw a bottle at the referee.
She shouted to us from the balcony.

rule_text_en: Use 'about' after talk/read/think/know (about). But 'discuss' is used without 'about'. 'Do something about' = take action.
rule_text_uk: Після talk/read/think/know вживаємо 'about'. Але 'discuss' без 'about'. 'Do something about' = вжити заходів.
examples: We talked about the holiday plan.
Let's discuss the budget tomorrow.
We must do something about the noise.

rule_text_en: Use 'for' after ask/wait/search/apply: ask for information, wait for a bus, apply for a job, search for keys.
rule_text_uk: Після ask/wait/search/apply вживаємо 'for': ask for information, wait for a bus, apply for a job, search for keys.
examples: I applied for a visa online.
We're waiting for a taxi.
She searched for her glasses.

rule_text_en: care about = think something is important; care for = look after (or like, in formal use); take care of = look after.
rule_text_uk: care about = вважати важливим; care for = доглядати (або «подобатися» у формальному стилі); take care of = доглядати.
rule_short_en: care about / care for / take care of
rule_short_uk: care about / care for / take care of
examples: I care about my students' progress.
Could you take care of the dog this weekend?
She cares for her elderly parents.

rule_text_en: look for = try to find; look after = take care of.
rule_text_uk: look for = шукати; look after = доглядати.
examples: I'm looking for my wallet.
Can you look after the children tonight?

rule_text_en: hear about = get news/information; hear of = know that somebody/something exists; hear from = receive a message from.
rule_text_uk: hear about = дізнатися новини/інформацію; hear of = знати, що щось/хтось існує; hear from = отримати звістку від.
examples: I heard about the accident on the radio.
Have you ever heard of that writer?
I haven't heard from her for weeks.

rule_text_en: think about = consider/reflect; think of = have an opinion or an idea; think of doing = consider doing.
rule_text_uk: think about = обмірковувати; think of = мати думку або ідею; think of doing = розглядати можливість зробити.
examples: What do you think of this photo?
I'm thinking about changing jobs.
Have you thought of a better plan?

rule_text_en: dream about = dream while sleeping or imagine; dream of = imagine strongly / often with a long-term wish.
rule_text_uk: dream about = снитися або уявляти; dream of = сильно/часто мріяти про щось (довгостроково).
examples: I dreamed about missing the train.
He dreams of starting his own business.

rule_text_en: complain about = say what is wrong; complain of = (formal) say you feel a pain/illness.
rule_text_uk: complain about = скаржитися на проблему; complain of = (офіц.) скаржитися на біль/нездужання.
examples: They complained about the slow service.
The patient complained of chest pain.

rule_text_en: remind somebody about something = make them remember; remind somebody of somebody/something = cause them to remember / be similar.
rule_text_uk: remind somebody about something = нагадати; remind somebody of somebody/something = нагадувати (викликати спогад/бути схожим).
examples: Remind me about the appointment tomorrow.
This song reminds me of my childhood.

rule_text_en: Verb + of: accuse/suspect somebody of, approve/disapprove of, consist of. die of/from: of (illness), from (cause/accident).
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + of: accuse/suspect somebody of, approve/disapprove of, consist of. die of/from: of (хвороба), from (причина/нещасний випадок).
examples: They accused him of cheating.
I don't approve of wasting food.
The team consists of five people.

rule_text_en: Verb + for: pay for something, apologise for, thank somebody for, blame somebody for something (or blame something on somebody).
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + for: pay for, apologise for, thank somebody for, blame somebody for something (або blame something on somebody).
examples: Thanks for your help.
She apologised for being late.
Don't blame me for the delay.

rule_text_en: Verb + from: suffer from (an illness), protect somebody/something from.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + from: suffer from (хвороба), protect somebody/something from.
examples: He suffers from migraines.
This jacket protects you from the wind.

rule_text_en: Verb + on: depend on/rely on, live on (money/food), congratulate/compliment somebody on.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + on: depend on/rely on, live on (гроші/їжа), congratulate/compliment somebody on.
examples: It depends on the weather.
They live on very little money.
Congratulations on your new job!

rule_text_en: Verb + in: believe in, succeed in, specialise in. After succeed in, use -ing or a noun.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + in: believe in, succeed in, specialise in. Після succeed in — іменник або -ing.
examples: Do you believe in ghosts?
She succeeded in finding a solution.
He specialises in web security.

rule_text_en: Verb + into: break into, bump/run into, divide/split into, translate something into another language.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + into: break into, bump/run into, divide/split into, translate something into іншу мову.
examples: Someone broke into our car.
I ran into an old friend yesterday.
Please translate this into Ukrainian.

rule_text_en: Verb + with: collide with, fill with, provide/supply somebody with something.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + with: collide with, fill with, provide/supply somebody with something.
examples: The truck collided with a bus.
Fill the form with black ink.
They supplied us with information.

rule_text_en: Verb + to: happen to, invite somebody to, prefer something to something else.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + to: happen to, invite somebody to, prefer something to something else.
examples: What happened to your phone?
They invited me to their wedding.
I prefer tea to coffee.

rule_text_en: Verb + on: concentrate on, insist on, spend money/time on.
rule_text_uk: Дієслово + on: concentrate on, insist on, spend гроші/час on.
examples: Please concentrate on the task.
He insisted on paying.
I spent a lot on repairs.

rule_text_en: Many phrasal verbs are verb + particle (up/down/in/out/on/off/away/back etc.). The particle can add a meaning like direction or completion.
rule_text_uk: Багато фразових дієслів = дієслово + частка (up/down/in/out/on/off/away/back тощо). Частка додає значення (напрямок/завершення).
examples: Come back at six.
The plane took off on time.
Please sit down.

rule_text_en: Some phrasal verbs have an idiomatic meaning: give up (stop), find out (discover), get on (progress/relationship), break down (stop working).
rule_text_uk: Деякі фразові дієслова мають ідіоматичне значення: give up (кинути), find out (дізнатися), get on (просуватися/ладнати), break down (зламатися).
examples: We found out the truth later.
My car broke down on the way.
Don't give up too soon.

rule_text_en: Some verbs are phrasal verb + preposition: get on with, look forward to, run out of. The extra preposition must be included.
rule_text_uk: Деякі конструкції = фразове дієслово + прийменник: get on with, look forward to, run out of. Додатковий прийменник обов’язковий.
examples: I'm looking forward to the weekend.
We ran out of milk.
How do you get on with your boss?

rule_text_en: With some phrasal verbs, the object can go in the middle or after (turn the light on / turn on the light). But with pronouns it goes in the middle (turn it on).
rule_text_uk: З деякими фразовими дієсловами додаток може бути посередині або після (turn the light on / turn on the light). Але з займенниками — лише посередині (turn it on).
rule_short_en: Object position: turn it on (not turn on it)
examples: Turn the radio off.
Turn it off, please.
Pick the book up / pick up the book.

rule_text_en: in/out describe movement to the inside/outside: get in/out, let somebody in/out. Use into/out of when you mention the place: into the room, out of the car.
rule_text_uk: in/out описують рух всередину/назовні: get in/out, let somebody in/out. Into/out of — коли називаємо місце: into the room, out of the car.
examples: She got into the taxi quickly.
He climbed out of the pool.
Let the cat in, please.

rule_text_en: Other phrasal verbs with in: drop in (visit), join in (participate), plug in (connect), fill in (complete a form), take in (deceive).
rule_text_uk: Інші фразові дієслова з in: drop in (зайти), join in (долучитися), plug in (підключити), fill in (заповнити), take in (обдурити).
rule_short_en: drop in / join in / plug in / fill in
rule_short_uk: drop in / join in / plug in / fill in
examples: Feel free to drop in any time.
Can you join in the game?
Fill in this form, please.

rule_text_en: Other phrasal verbs with out: eat out (in a restaurant), drop out (leave a course), leave out (omit), cross out (delete).
rule_text_uk: Інші фразові дієслова з out: eat out (їсти в ресторані), drop out (кинути курс), leave out (пропустити), cross out (закреслити).
rule_short_en: eat out / drop out / leave out / cross out
rule_short_uk: eat out / drop out / leave out / cross out
examples: We usually eat out on Fridays.
He dropped out of university.
Cross out the wrong answer.

rule_text_en: out can mean 'not burning / not shining': go out, put out (a fire), blow out (a candle), turn out (a light).
rule_text_uk: out може означати «не горить/не світить»: go out, put out (пожежу), blow out (свічку), turn out (світло).
examples: The candle went out in the wind.
Firefighters put out the fire quickly.
Turn out the light when you leave.

rule_text_en: work out can mean: do exercise; develop successfully; calculate; find a solution.
rule_text_uk: work out може означати: тренуватися; добре скластися; порахувати; знайти рішення.
rule_short_en: work out = exercise / succeed / calculate / solve
rule_short_uk: work out = тренування / вийшло / порахувати / вирішити
examples: I work out three times a week.
Everything worked out in the end.
Can you work out the total?

rule_text_en: Other verbs + out: find out (discover), carry out (do), point out (mention), run out of (have no more), sort out (organise/solve), try out (test).
rule_text_uk: Інші дієслова + out: find out (дізнатися), carry out (виконати), point out (зазначити), run out of (закінчитися), sort out (розібратися), try out (випробувати).
examples: We need to find out what happened.
They carried out an experiment.
We ran out of time.

rule_text_en: Use on/off with many devices: turn/switch something on or off. 'Put on' can mean 'switch on' (radio, kettle).
rule_text_uk: On/off вживаємо з багатьма пристроями: turn/switch something on/off. 'Put on' також може означати 'увімкнути' (радіо, чайник).
examples: Can you switch the lights off, please?
I turned the heating on before we arrived.
Put the kettle on and I'll make tea.

rule_text_en: go on = continue/happen; call off = cancel; put off = postpone until later.
rule_text_uk: go on = продовжуватися/відбуватися; call off = скасувати; put off = відкласти на потім.
rule_short_en: go on / call off / put off
rule_short_uk: go on / call off / put off
examples: The concert went on despite the rain.
They called off the meeting at the last minute.
Let's put off the decision until Monday.

rule_text_en: For clothes: put on = start wearing; try on = test size/fit; take off = remove.
rule_text_uk: Про одяг: put on = одягнути; try on = приміряти; take off = зняти.
rule_short_en: put on / try on / take off (clothes)
rule_short_uk: put on / try on / take off (clothes)
examples: He put on his coat and went out.
I tried the jacket on, but it was too small.
Take your shoes off at the door.

rule_text_en: More '… off': be off = leave (going somewhere); go/set off = start a journey/leave; take off = plane leaves ground; see somebody off = go to the station/airport with them.
rule_text_uk: …off: be off = вирушати; go/set off = стартувати/вирушати; take off = (літак) злітає; see somebody off = проводжати.
examples: I'm off now—see you tomorrow.
We set off at dawn.
Their flight took off on time.
We went to the airport to see her off.

rule_text_en: go on/carry on/keep on mean 'continue'. You can say go on doing, carry on doing, or carry on with something.
rule_text_uk: go on/carry on/keep on = «продовжувати». Можна: go on doing, carry on doing або carry on with something.
rule_short_en: go on / carry on / keep on
rule_short_uk: go on / carry on / keep on
examples: She kept on talking even after the bell.
Let's go on with the story.
He carried on working until midnight.

rule_text_en: get on can mean 'make progress' (How are you getting on?), or 'have a good relationship' (get on with somebody). get on with something = continue doing it.
rule_text_uk: get on: «просуватися» (How are you getting on?), або «ладнати» (get on with somebody). get on with something = продовжувати роботу.
examples: How are you getting on with your project?
I get on well with my neighbours.
Stop chatting and get on with it.

rule_text_en: Common '… off' verbs: doze/nod off = fall asleep; finish off = complete; go off = ring/explode (alarm); put somebody off = discourage; rip somebody off = overcharge; show off = try to impress; tell off = speak angrily.
rule_text_uk: Поширені '… off': doze/nod off = задрімати; finish off = доробити; go off = спрацювати/задзвонити (сигналізація); put sb off = відбити бажання; rip sb off = обдурити/здерти гроші; show off; tell off.
examples: I nodded off during the film.
Let's finish off the report today.
The alarm went off at 6.
Don't show off—just be yourself.

rule_text_en: Many verbs use up (to a higher position) and down (to a lower position): stand up / sit down; pick something up / put something down; turn up / turn down (volume).
rule_text_uk: Up/down часто показують рух: stand up / sit down; pick up / put down; turn up / turn down (гучність).
examples: Please stand up for a moment.
He picked the keys up and put them in his pocket.
Turn the music down.

rule_text_en: knock/cut/burn something down often mean 'destroy so it falls' (a building, trees). be knocked down = hit by a vehicle/fall over.
rule_text_uk: knock/cut/burn something down = «знести/зруйнувати». be knocked down = збити/звалитися.
examples: They knocked the old house down.
A storm cut several trees down.
The warehouse burned down last night.

rule_text_en: down can mean 'less' or 'slower': slow down, calm down, cut down on (reduce).
rule_text_uk: Down може означати «менше/повільніше»: slow down, calm down, cut down on (зменшити).
examples: Slow down—you're driving too fast.
Calm down and tell me what happened.
I'm trying to cut down on sugar.

rule_text_en: Other common '… down' verbs: break down (machine stops); shut down (close/stop operating); let somebody down (disappoint); write something down (note); turn down (reject/refuse or lower).
rule_text_uk: Інші '… down': break down = зламатися; shut down = закрити/зупинити; let sb down = підвести; write down = записати; turn down = відмовити/зменшити.
examples: My car broke down on the way home.
They shut the computer system down for maintenance.
I don't want to let you down.
Write the address down.

rule_text_en: catch up = reach the same level; keep up = not fall behind; hurry up = do something faster.
rule_text_uk: catch up = наздогнати; keep up = не відставати; hurry up = поспішати/робити швидше.
rule_short_en: catch up / keep up / hurry up
rule_short_uk: catch up / keep up / hurry up
examples: I missed two lessons, so I need to catch up.
Try to keep up with the group.
Hurry up—we're late.

rule_text_en: set up = arrange/start (a system, business); take up = start a hobby or use space/time; fix up = repair or arrange (often informally).
rule_text_uk: set up = організувати/заснувати; take up = почати хобі або займати місце/час; fix up = полагодити/влаштувати (розм.).
rule_short_en: set up / take up / fix up
rule_short_uk: set up / take up / fix up
examples: She set up an online shop.
He took up running last year.
Can you fix up the shelf?

rule_text_en: grow up = become an adult; bring up = raise a child or mention a topic.
rule_text_uk: grow up = дорослішати; bring up = виховувати або «підняти тему».
examples: I grew up in a small town.
They brought up three children.
Don't bring that up again.

rule_text_en: clean up = make a place tidy/clean; wash up = wash dishes or clean your hands/face (informal).
rule_text_uk: clean up = прибрати; wash up = помити посуд або вмитися (розм.).
examples: We need to clean up after the party.
I'll wash up while you dry.

rule_text_en: More '… up': end up = finally be in a situation; give up = stop trying; make up = invent; turn up/show up = arrive/appear; use up = consume all of something.
rule_text_uk: …up: end up = врешті опинитися; give up = здатися/кинути; make up = вигадати; turn up/show up = з'явитися; use up = витратити все.
rule_short_en: end up / give up / make up / turn up / use up
rule_short_uk: end up / give up / make up / turn up / use up
examples: We ended up staying at home.
Don't give up yet.
He made the story up.
She turned up late.
We've used up all the milk.

rule_text_en: bring up a topic = introduce it; come up = be mentioned/happen unexpectedly; come up with = produce an idea; make something up = invent (a story/excuse).
rule_text_uk: bring up = підняти тему; come up = з'явитися/виникнути; come up with = придумати; make up = вигадати (історію/виправдання).
rule_short_en: bring up / come up / come up with / make up
rule_short_uk: bring up / come up / come up with / make up
examples: His name came up in the meeting.
Can you come up with a plan?
She made an excuse up.

rule_text_en: cheer up = become happier (or make somebody happier); save up = keep money for later; clear up = weather becomes brighter/better.
rule_text_uk: cheer up = підбадьоритися/підбадьорити; save up = назбирати грошей; clear up = (про погоду) прояснитися.
rule_short_en: cheer up / save up / clear up
rule_short_uk: cheer up / save up / clear up
examples: Cheer up—it's not that bad.
I'm saving up for a new bike.
It should clear up by afternoon.

rule_text_en: blow up = explode (or destroy by explosion); tear up = tear into pieces; beat somebody up = hit repeatedly and hurt them.
rule_text_uk: blow up = вибухнути/підірвати; tear up = розірвати; beat sb up = побити.
rule_short_en: blow up / tear up / beat up
rule_short_uk: blow up / tear up / beat up
examples: The tyre blew up on the motorway.
He tore the note up.
Someone was beaten up outside the club.

rule_text_en: break up/split up = separate; do up = fasten or renovate; look up = search in a dictionary; put up with = tolerate; hold up = delay; mix up = confuse two things/people.
rule_text_uk: break up/split up = розійтися; do up = застебнути або відремонтувати; look up = перевірити в словнику; put up with = терпіти; hold up = затримати; mix up = переплутати.
rule_short_en: break up / do up / look up / put up with / hold up / mix up
rule_short_uk: break up / do up / look up / put up with / hold up / mix up
examples: They split up last year.
Do your coat up—it's cold.
Look the word up.
Traffic held us up.

rule_text_en: away = away from home/a place; back = return. You can say go/drive/walk away and come/go/get back, give something back, put something back.
rule_text_uk: away = «геть/з місця/з дому»; back = «назад/повернутися».: go/drive away; come/go/get back; give/put back.
examples: She walked away without a word.
When will you be back?
Please put the book back.

rule_text_en: Common '… away': get away (escape); get away with (do wrong without punishment); keep away (from) (don't go near); give away (donate/reveal); put away (tidy/store); throw away (discard).
rule_text_uk: …away: get away = втекти; get away with = «зійти з рук»; keep away (from) = не підходити; give away = віддати/видати; put away = прибрати; throw away = викинути.
examples: The thief got away.
He got away with lying.
Keep away from the edge.
Don't throw it away.

rule_text_en: Common '… back': wave/smile/shout back; call back (return a call); get back to somebody (reply later); look back (on) = think about the past; pay back = return money.
rule_text_uk: …back: wave/smile/shout back; call back = передзвонити; get back to sb = відповісти пізніше; look back (on) = озиратися в минуле; pay back = повернути гроші.
examples: I waved and she waved back.
I'll call you back in ten minutes.
He never got back to me.
I'll pay you back next week.
